title: Project: Netherlands hospital records
body:
Summary of request: Split an existing ROR record into two or more records

Hospitals in The Netherlands

**ROR ID(s) affected by this proposed change** 
(see WikiData Query)

**Describe what change needs to be made to the ROR record(s). Provide a reason for the change (e.g., the organization no longer exists, or the organization has merged with another one)**
I modified all Hospitals in the Netherlands on WikiData: Split it in buildings (Q16917 - Hospital) and Organisations (Q89371670 - Hospital Network). This has implications voor ROR-id and other ID's involved. 

WikiData SPARQL Query: 
<#Hospitals networks in The NetherlandsSELECT?item ?itemLabel ?iseen?ziekenhuis ?ziekenhuisLabel?rol ?rolLabel ?hap ?hapLabel?adres ?huisnummer?postcode ?plaats ?plaatsLabel ?geo?web?gridid ?rorid ?isni ?viafidWHERE{?item wdt:P31 wd:Q89371670 .?item wdt:P17 wd:Q55 .?item wdt:P527 ?ziekenhuis .OPTIONAL{?item wdt:P6375 ?adres .}OPTIONAL{?huisnummer wdt:P670 ?huisnummer .}OPTIONAL{?item wdt:P281 ?postcode .}OPTIONAL{?item wdt:P131 ?plaats .}OPTIONAL{?item wdt:P856 ?web .}OPTIONAL{?item wdt:P625 ?geo .}OPTIONAL{?item wdt:P2427 ?gridid .}OPTIONAL{?item wdt:P6782 ?rorid .}OPTIONAL{?item wdt:P213 ?isni .}OPTIONAL{?item wdt:P214 ?viafid .}SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],nl". }}ORDER BY ?item>

Please will you correct ROR-id's of Hospitals in The Netherlands? Best Regards, Gerald Wildenbeest (Wikipedian - gewild)
comments:
mariagould
11/02/2021, 22:21:24 | 11/02/2021, 22:21:24
comment_text: @arthurpsmith are you able to take a look at this one? I'm not quite sure what the desired outcome is. 

---
arthurpsmith
11/03/2021, 12:55:41 | 11/03/2021, 12:55:41
comment_text: I'm also not sure but I think the point is there are lots of hospitals in the Netherlands that don't have ROR id's yet? But I don't think we want to create ID's for every hospital - we certainly haven't done that for every hospital in the US or other countries!

The Wikidata query at least as transcribed here is a bit garbled; I edited and trimmed it down to the following:
https://w.wiki/4Kyd
which lists the hospital networks in the Netherlands, how many individual hospital (buildings?) they have, and the ROR id if they have one. It's 69 hospital groups, of which 16 (mostly the larger ones) currently have ROR id's. I don't think it's justified to add ROR id's for the remaining 53; we could look through them one by one to see if they are used as affiliations or otherwise  appear in research publications, but that seems a bit too much for our resources right now. Also the request was nominally to "split an existing ROR record" but I don't see that in this query or request at all, so  I have to say I'm a little confused as to what is actually being asked for.

---
arthurpsmith
11/03/2021, 13:03:47 | 11/03/2021, 13:03:47
comment_text: Ah, but it turns out a lot of the individual hospitals have ROR id's themselves (at least as recorded in  WIkidata):
https://w.wiki/4Kyg
-- that is, of the 69 hospital groups, 47 have at least one hospital with a ROR id. That includes 5 groups that have their own ROR id's. It seems a bit of a mess, I'll see if I can make better sense of it all and try to propose a way forward here.

---
arthurpsmith
11/18/2021, 21:45:36 | 11/18/2021, 21:45:36
comment_text: I created a google doc with the full list from Wikidata  here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GPjrMuojAUwzKKh4-03MHWFYXdjGDLXbHbUcogo9Hbs/edit?usp=sharing

The following hospital group/networks don't have any ROR id's themselves, nor any subsidiary hospitals with ROR's (at least as counted here):
* Ommelander Ziekenhuis Groningen (Q1943201)
* Pantein (Q1978017)
* ZorgSaam Ziekenhuis (Q3034260)
* St Jansdal Ziekenhuis (Q59384173)
* Saxenburgh Groep (Q97380654)
* Antonius Zorggroep (Q97382945)
* Rivas Zorggroep (Q97383459)
* BovenIJ Ziekenhuis (Q97456244)
* St. Jans Gasthuis (Q97482069)
* Spijkenisse Medisch Centrum (Q97500811)
* Wilhelmina Ziekenhuis Assen (Q97537594)

I would suggest these do not need ROR id's at this time, though we could run them through our usual check for use as affiliations if we thought it justified?

The  following hospital groups have no ROR id, but do have either multiple subsidiaries with a ROR id, or one with a ROR id and a considerably different name, so I think we should create a new ROR id for these "top-level" research-involved hospital organizations: 
* OLVG (Q21152541)
* Dijklander Ziekenhuis (Q62022997)
* Zorgpartners Friesland (Q97377399)
* Stichting Reinier Haga Groep (Q97383180)

title: Project: Add European Reference Networks
body:
This is a bulk request to review the proposed addition of all European Reference Network entities. The proposed additions are in this spreadsheet:

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1edwGR1NO2AivGgfkoZ4DCyfltuifEEjs/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=109671855708944259476&rtpof=true&sd=true
 
Background information received: 

> "The European Reference Networks fall within the scope of ROR. I found a record for one of the ERNs (ERN Guard Heart; https://ror.org/055s7a943), but there are 23 ERNs that are not yet available [...] [T]hese are fairly new research networks (within the last 5 years) so publication data may not be available. Additional information about the networks can be found on the European Commission's website: https://ec.europa.eu/health/ern/networks_en."

The linked spreadsheet includes the proposed additions, with the following notes:

> "ERN parent organization: The first row contains the information for the parent organization (The Board of the Member States for the ERNs). If this entry is accepted, then the ROR ID of the parent organization should be applied to all of the ERNS."
> "Update Request: For the ERN that already exists in ROR (ERN GUARD-HEART, https://ror.org/055s7a943), I have an update. I have added the related ROR organization and location information."

title: Project: Standardize representation of records for the Czech Academy of Sciences
body:
The records for the Czech Academy of Sciences have inconsistent representations, impeding discovery in ROR. See [Issue #431](https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates/issues/431) for an example.

A ROR user has created a full mapping of our data with these institutions (https://github.com/jdvorak001/isvavai-orgs-ror-mapping/blob/main/organizations.csv), whose work and expertise we should consider consulting. What appears to be official English names are also linked here: https://www.avcr.cz/en/about-us/cas-structure/research-institutes/
comments:
jdvorak001
01/19/2022, 23:52:04 | 01/19/2022, 23:52:04
comment_text: I agree this would be useful.
Adding the "... of the CAS" suffixes would help, otherwise the names are sometimes rather generic.

I will be happy to assist.

---
adambuttrick
06/17/2022, 00:28:59 | 06/17/2022, 00:28:59
comment_text: Records updated as part of release v1.1.

title: Project: Norwegian research institutions
body:
Sikt - Norwegian Agency for Shared Services in Education and Research is undertaking a project to develop a national knowledge archive for Norway. Many of the organizations in their registry are already in ROR but some are not. The linked spreadsheet includes 5 that they wish to add. It looks like one is already in ROR but I am waiting on the requestor to verify.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ubvpTLbBfZSRCEjMQO3atZ-EaPvtAjWDSwhK6fLbggM/edit#gid=0

Per Sikt, these are "non-education institutions that do research equal to universities, with more or less governmental funding and mandate. Some of them are located to a facility, but most are not."
comments:
garshol
04/29/2022, 11:00:39 | 04/29/2022, 11:00:39
comment_text: Yes, HL-Center already got a ror - https://ror.org/03ppkyp25. It’s the same institution.

---
arthurpsmith
05/18/2022, 20:25:28 | 05/18/2022, 20:25:28
comment_text: Once again the project spreadsheet is not currently accessible to me. I've requested access.

---
mariagould
05/18/2022, 21:01:26 | 05/18/2022, 21:01:26
comment_text: @arthurpsmith sorry about that! The access issue should be resolved now. 

---
arthurpsmith
05/19/2022, 13:52:56 | 05/19/2022, 13:52:56
comment_text: Ok, I've reviewed these and added my assessments.
One of the 4 remaining ones is also already in ROR - https://ror.org/01vmqaq17 has changed its name to NORSUS.
Of the other 3, two had clear uses as affiliations and do seem actively engaged in research. The last is the new one and doesn't seem to have been used as an affiliation itself yet - I'm not sure why as it's not so very new but even very recent (2022) publications by the listed author seem to use a different affiliation, and google scholar found nothing. Nevertheless I suppose for completeness it would be useful to add this one also.


---

comments:
adambuttrick
04/15/2022, 21:44:19 | 04/15/2022, 21:44:19
comment_text: Identified as part of the relationships in #442. Marine research institute that administers graduate programs for the College of William And Mary. Funds and employs researchers who use this as a leading affiliation on plenty of research.

I could go either way on this request, maybe leading towards denying because of how closely tied the are to the university, so would appreciate additional feedback.

Google Scholar affiliation usage: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=mp1TNOAAAAAJ; https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=bVEVdsEAAAAJ; https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=lBVyt8oAAAAJ

---
arthurpsmith
05/19/2022, 17:38:27 | 05/19/2022, 17:38:27
comment_text: It has its own website, and seems to be listed on its own (without mention of William & Mary) in most affiliation usage. On the other hand the relation with W&M seems a bit confusing. From this page: https://www.vims.edu/about/leadership_admin/vims_boards/index.php it looks like they report to two separate boards, one of which is the one responsible for the college, but which also states "VIMS is a state agency, established in the Code of Virginia, and an institution of higher education with a tripartite mission of research, education, and advisory services." It may not be exactly 'top level', but it seems close enough for me. I'm moving this to needs discussion since I'm not quite sure what Adam's position is, but if he's ok with creating a ROR for this then let's do that. Thanks.

---
adambuttrick
05/19/2022, 17:40:47 | 05/19/2022, 17:40:47
comment_text: @arthurpsmith I was on the fence, but am fine with approving, given your feedback!

---
adambuttrick
06/16/2022, 23:41:23 | 06/16/2022, 23:41:23
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/04eeqc889 in release v1.1.

title: Add a new organization to ROR: Continental Scientific Drilling Facility
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Continental Scientific Drilling Facility
Website: https://cse.umn.edu/csd
Link to publications: 
Organization type: Facility
Wikipedia page:
Wikidata ID:
ISNI ID:
GRID ID:
Crossref Funder ID:
Other names for the organization:
Acronym/abbreviation: CSD
Related organizations: https://ror.org/017zqws13 (parent)
City: Minneapolis, Minnesota
Country: USA
Geonames ID: 5037649
Year established: 2021
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? 
Other information about this request:


Briefly explain why you are requesting a ROR ID for this organization and how the ROR ID will be used. | The Continental Scientific Drilling Facility is a national facility funded by NSF for support of scientific research involving drilling and coring on land and in lakes, core analysis, and curation. The ROR ID will allow unique linkages between the facility and the researchers it supports, and the outputs from this research.

Provide DOI(s) or links for research associated with this organization, such as published articles that include the organization's name as an affiliation. If DOIs or links are not available, describe the research-related activities of this organization. | https://experts.umn.edu/en/organisations/continental-scientific-drilling-facility

Other relevant metadata about the organization (e.g., name variants in other languages, related records in ROR, links to external records such as Wikidata) | Name variants include CSD Facility, CSDF, and the former facilities that merged to form the current facility in mid-2020: LacCore and CSDCO (Continental Scientific Drilling Coordination Office). Earlier variants include the Limnological Research Center or LRC, which sometimes still appear in publications.

Please add any other information about this request if needed | We are rebuilding our website and will soon have a new URL, which we will update with ROR when the website launches.
comments:
nlundvick
05/10/2021, 19:30:16 | 05/10/2021, 19:30:16
comment_text: Determination: The **Continental Scientific Drilling Coordination Office (CSDCO)** is an NSF research facility sufficiently independent from parent organization (University of Minnesota) and has affiliation use (see https://sd.copernicus.org/articles/26/1/2019/). Recommend adding CSDCO to ROR

---
arthurpsmith
05/17/2021, 18:31:26 | 05/17/2021, 18:31:26
comment_text: The request indicates this is a new organization - "Continental Scientific Drilling Facility", which combines the older LacCore and CSDCO. I cannot find any reference to this new organization other than the link they provide for publications: https://experts.umn.edu/en/organisations/continental-scientific-drilling-facility and an NSF grant award from May last year: https://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1951112

As @nlundvick noted there are affiliations using the older entities (although they also seem to always be at University of Minnesota). The CSDCO website which is the main link provided does not mention the new name. Perhaps we should wait for their new website? Otherwise I do think this is generally suitable.

---
nlundvick
06/03/2021, 18:27:31 | 06/03/2021, 18:27:31
comment_text: I agree with @arthurpsmith - should wait until there is an official website that has "Continental Scientific Drilling Facility" as name of new org created by merger of LacCore and CSDCO. I propose moving to Hold for Later

---
arthurpsmith
06/04/2021, 14:33:50 | 06/04/2021, 14:33:50
comment_text: I moved it - we should review maybe in September 2021?

---
adambuttrick
05/23/2022, 17:33:31 | 05/23/2022, 17:33:31
comment_text: New site is live, so this should be processed:

https://cse.umn.edu/csd

---
adambuttrick

comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/02amckb22 in release v1.1.

comment_text: I added the ISNI id.

Searching Goolge scholar I found only a handful of publications from this institute, with 3 different authors, only two of whom actually used the institute as an affiliation; both published only in "IRJMS" (https://www.irjms.com) which is a very new journal and seems a little sketchy. The website for the institute seems to be mostly talking about the founder, with great plans for the future and some recent donations etc. but not much that I can see of current status (I don't see any lists of actual researchers anywhere?) I guess it's still a new organization. I'd be inclined to hold this one for later? Willing to defer to a second opinion on this though.

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
VSL National Metrology Institute https://ror.org/05ap1vt50
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Update record:
Name of organization: VSL National Metrology Institute
ROR ID: https://ror.org/05ap1vt50
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Other names or name versions listed in the record, Organization website
Description of change: In 2009 the NMi Van Swinden Laboratory was renamed "VSL" (see https://nl.wikipedia.org/wiki/VSL_(metrologie)). Current Dutch name = "VSL - Nationaal Metrologisch Instituut". Web address: https://www.vsl.nl/

Update: change.name == VSL Dutch Metrology Institute; replace.aliases== Van Swinden Laboratory Dutch Metrology Institute; add.aliases==Van Swinden Laboratorium; add.aliases==National Metrology Institute of the Netherlands; add.aliases==Netherlands Metrology Institute; replace.acronyms==VSLNMI; add.acronyms==VSLDMI; replace.labels==VSL Nationaal Metrologisch Instituut*Dutch; replace.links==https://www.vsl.nl;$
comments:
adambuttrick
05/20/2022, 08:11:15 | 05/20/2022, 08:13:26
comment_text: I think this proposed change may be fine, although what the ROR record (inherited from GRID) was intended to capture is a little murky. It has aliases and acronyms for the entity "NMi-Van Swinden Laboratorium," but according to Wikipedia, these two were split apart in 2009. NMi still exists as a separate organization (https://nmi.nl/) and is also in ROR (https://ror.org/053xpwt63). This may have been an error on GRID's part or simply was never updated. I think there probably should have been a deprecation and split, but if others agree this is the record for the split VSL entity, consistent with NMi's separate representation in ROR, I will update accordingly.

---
mariagould
06/01/2022, 20:27:25 | 06/01/2022, 20:27:25
comment_text: I think it makes sense to treat this one as the primary VSL entry. The one suggestion I would make would be to the aliases. I would move "Van Swinden Laboratorium" to aliases, and I would also include other versions of the English name that appear to be in use ("National Metrology Institute of the Netherlands," "Netherlands Metrology Institute")

---
adambuttrick
06/17/2022, 00:28:14 | 06/17/2022, 00:28:14
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.1.

---

comments:
adambuttrick
05/24/2022, 16:49:23 | 05/24/2022, 16:51:23
comment_text: Chinese organization responsible for metrology and related services. Solid affiliation usage. Similar to https://ror.org/02m5haa59 and https://ror.org/035gbps25.

The correct link for this organization is http://www.birm-weather.com/, per Wikidata and the LinkedIn page, but from the Wayback Machine archive, it appears to have been offline for a few years (last indexing is from 2019). I'm seeing affiliation usage from 2022 (https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/abstract/document/9721065), so they are likely still active. Not certain if we should just drop the link entirely, include dead, or something else.

They also appear to be a sub-entity of a state-owned corporation, which makes them more a company than a Goverment organization, although admittedly, this is a bit nebulous. Parent, which is also a state-owned corporation, is listed as a company. Perhaps this is a case for having more than one type?

Publication affiliation usage: https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/abstract/document/9721065; https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8088896
Google Scholar affiliation usage: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=QUdEqnIAAAAJ
ORCID affiliation usage: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3621-0029 ; https://orcid.org/0000-0002-4159-3450 ; https://orcid.org/

title:
Add a new organization to ROR: 
 
GO FAIR FOUNDATION
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: GO FAIR FOUNDATION
Website: https://www.gofairfoundation.org
Link to publications: https://www.scidatacon.org/virtual-2021/sessions/375/
Organization type: Nonprofit (A non-profit and non-governmental organization involved in conducting or funding research)
Wikipedia page: 
Wikidata ID: 
ISNI ID: 
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Other names for the organization:
Acronym/abbreviation: GFF
Labels: STICHTING GO FAIR*Dutch
Related organizations: 
City: LEIDEN
Country: NETHERLANDS 
Geonames ID: 2751773
Year established: 2018
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for research publications, To identify affiliations for datasets, To acknowledge research funders, To acknowledge a research facility
Other information about this request: GFF supports the FAIR Principles and the GO FAIR movement, by preparing the implementing of a coherent certification program and by coordinating international missionary and kickstart activities for FAIR related projects worldwide.
comments:
mariagould
03/14/2022, 22:17:24 | 03/14/2022, 22:17:24
comment_text: This request still needs to proceed through the review process. This is an independent organization involved in supporting and certifying activities around FAIR data. 

Per follow-up email, the intended use case for a ROR ID is to identify the foundation as the certifying entity for FAIR Implementation Profiles: 

> It is a project with the ENVRI-FAIR consortium (https://envri.eu/home-envri-fair/) that has increased the urgency for the ROR ID. The GFF has been commissioned, along with the Environmental Agency Austria to upgrade a tool call FAIR Implementation Profile Wizard, which helps communities to create machine-readable FAIR Implementation Profiles. The ENVRI-FAIR consortium, in close collaboration with GO FAIR, have been leading the development of the FAIR Implementation Profile method, and the FIP Wizard tool. [...] A key function, namely the GFF “qualification” or endorsement of FAIR Enabling Resources, will require a globally unique and persistent identifier for the GO FAIR Foundation. Hence, our request. 

The foundation does appear as an affiliation in extant publications (e.g., https://doi.org/10.1162/dint_a_00050).

The foundation is related the GO FAIR initiative (https://www.go-fair.org/) as well as to the GO FAIR International Support and Coordination Office (GFISCO) (https://www.go-fair.org/go-fair-initiative/go-fair-offices/). 

I think it is in scope for ROR to represent GO FAIR as an organization that is involved in certifying and producing research, but I think we need to review whether the ROR record should reflect the foundation, the International Support and Coordination Office (GFISCO), or the overall initiative. 

Additional review from curators is needed in order to make a determination about how we should proceed. 


---
arthurpsmith
05/17/2022, 17:22:12 | 05/17/2022, 17:22:12
comment_text: The initiative has a Wikidata id (Q49984485); GFISCO's website is under the initiative website. Both GFISCO and the GFF are used as affiliations. The GFF website claims they support GFISCO (among other things) and points to the initiative website for that.

I think from all the above that GFF acts like a top-level organization here, and given that the request specifically asked for the foundation to be recognized and it is actually an organization (as opposed to a project or initiative) I think that does make the most sense. So yes let's create a ROR id for the GO FAIR Foundation as requested here.

---
adambuttrick
06/16/2022, 23:32:34 | 06/16/2022, 23:48:46
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/056j50v04 in release v1.1.

title: Add a new organization to ROR: Uniting
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Uniting
Website: https://www.uniting.org
Link to publications: https://www.uniting.org/community-impact/research-and-innovation, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.drugalcdep.2020.107909, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.drugpo.2019.01.026
Organization type: Nonprofit
Wikipedia page:
Wikidata ID:
ISNI ID:
GRID ID:
Crossref Funder ID:
Other names for the organization: 
Acronym/abbreviation:
Related organizations: 
City: Sydney
Country: Australia
Geonames ID: 2147714
Year established:
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? 
Other information about this request:
comments:
mariagould
03/18/2022, 19:06:37 | 03/18/2022, 19:06:37
comment_text: This is a legacy issue from 2020. The organization was suggested by the Swiss National Science Foundation to identify affiliations in SNSF-funded research. ROR recommended the addition to GRID but the addition was not approved at the time so the request has been on hold since then. I am now reinstating it so we can consider it for inclusion in ROR. 

The organization is a nonprofit affiliated with the Uniting Church in Australia. It appears that most of the organization's research publications are associated with the Uniting Medically Supervised Injection Centre (Uniting MSIC). We should consider whether to create a ROR ID for Uniting or for Uniting MSIC. 



---
arthurpsmith
05/17/2022, 19:16:11 | 05/17/2022, 19:16:11
comment_text: Yes, I think we should have something for this. How about creating a ROR id for the overall church (Uniting Church in Australia)? We do have https://ror.org/04m5qh397 for the Church of England, for example and a number of others (https://ror.org/03vpkt967, https://ror.org/012hhd379, etc.)

Uniting MSIC seems to be one service provided in Sydney (https://www.uniting.org/community-impact/uniting-medically-supervised-injecting-centre--msic) - I guess it is used as an affiliation the way some hospitals and clinics would be, and we have plenty of those, so I suppose a ROR id for that would be ok too.

However, "Uniting" as a whole seems to be responsible for a lot more services than just this MSIC, particularly care for the aged and mental health care. It's a little hard to search for research from them as "Uniting" is hardly a unique string to search on. Their "Research and Innovation" page here: https://www.uniting.org/community-impact/research-and-innovation lists a wide variety of research projects they are involved with, with relations with about two dozen universities. So it seems to me that this organization in itself should qualify for a ROR id as a research-involved nonprofit/medical care organization.

So my recommendation is to add a ROR id for Uniting as requested in this issue, and then consider additional ROR id's for a parent (Uniting Church in Australia) and child (Uniting MSIC, Sydney).

---
adambuttrick
06/16/2022, 23:41:13 | 06/16/2022, 23:41:13
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/01qx0e979 in release v1.1.

Country: Spain
Geonames ID: 3128760
Year established: 1999
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? To identify affiliations for datasets, To be used in DataCite

Other information about this request:
comments:
adambuttrick
02/24/2022, 16:29:27 | 02/24/2022, 16:31:12
comment_text: Organization that exists to fulfill Spain's obligations under the Antarctic Treaty, specifically as it relates to the free exchange of scientific datasets produced by Spanish researchers working in the polar regions. See Spanish government's description [here](https://www.ciencia.gob.es/Organismos-y-Centros/Comite-Polar-Espanol/Centro-Nacional-de-Datos-Polares.html;jsessionid=ACBDF8CE4ED75BEB164AD297765FDE97.2) . Stores and publishes these datasets (http://cndp.utm.csic.es/catalogue/srv/eng/catalog.search#/search?resultType=details&sortBy=relevance&from=1&to=20). Should be added to ROR.

---
arthurpsmith
04/22/2022, 13:23:13 | 04/22/2022, 13:23:13
comment_text: Not clear this qualifies as a "top-level" institution - it's part of UTM (which is part of CSIC), and the website is under the UTM domain. The two "parent" organizations listed are just UTM and CSIC. UTM is in Barcelona as is this center.

HOWEVER - the UTM website makes absolutely no mention of CNDP other than listing 4 staff in Antarctica, and it appears CNDP was established before UTM in its current incarnation (2000). So I'm inclined to go ahead and agree this should be treated as an independent organization that should have its own ROR id.

---
adambuttrick
06/16/2022, 23:40:58 | 06/16/2022, 23:40:58
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/00ybwtz11 in release v1.1.

I did find some English-language papers using the name "Millennium Institute for Subatomic Physics at High-Energy Frontier - SAPHIR" as an affiliation - https://arxiv.org/pdf/2204.03256.pdf and https://doi.org/10.1140/epjc/s10052-021-09535-5

title: Add a new organization to ROR: Joint Fire Science Program
body:
Summary of request: Add a new organization to ROR

Name of organization: Joint Fire Science Program
Website: https://www.firescience.gov
Link to publications: https://www.firescience.gov/JFSP_publications.cfm, https://search.crossref.org/funding?q=100015231
Organization type: Government
Wikipedia page:
Wikidata ID: Q30297389
ISNI ID: 0000 0004 8339 055X
GRID ID:
Crossref Funder ID: 100015231
Other names for the organization: 
Acronym/abbreviation: JFSP
Related organizations: https://ror.org/03zmjc935 (parent) https://ror.org/03v0pmy70 (parent)
City: Boise, Idaho
Country: United States
Geonames ID: 5586437
Year established: 1998

How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? This is a funding organization that is represented in the DMPTool, which integrates with ROR. A ROR ID for JFSP will identify research projects funded by the organization. 

Other information about this request: This ID has been requested by the DMPTool. In the course of reviewing the request we realized that this organization was previously assigned an ID in GRID (grid.454813.f) and then redirected to the record for the Department of the Interior (grid.239134.e, https://ror.org/03v0pmy70). This happened prior to ROR's existence so we never registered a ROR ID.
comments:
mariagould
03/16/2022, 20:03:22 | 03/16/2022, 20:03:22
comment_text: This is a legacy request that ROR received from DMPTool in 2020. DMPTool requested the ROR ID in order to be able to connect JFSP to the research projects that it funds. We were not able to process the request at that time because the record had previously been deprecated by GRID and was not likely to be reinstated. I am re-opening the request so that we can review it for a future ROR release. I recommend adding to ROR because it is an identified funder associated with published research. It is distinct from the Department of the Interior (the record that GRID redirected it to) because it is jointly operated by both DOI and the US Forest Service. 

---
carlyrobinson
04/26/2022, 12:52:47 | 04/26/2022, 12:52:47
comment_text: I agree with the assessment. Recommend adding to ROR.

---
adambuttrick
06/16/2022, 23:39:48 | 06/16/2022, 23:39:48
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/03ccbtk93 in release v1.1.

adambuttrick
04/01/2022, 05:25:35 | 04/01/2022, 05:35:55
comment_text: Research institute that is a part of the Universidade Lueji A'Nkonde. Not a top-level entity, but does have affiliation usage that references only the institute (vs. institute + university). Examples:
https://revistas.ipls.ao/index.php/kulongesa-tes/article/download/314/164 ; https://revistas.ipls.ao/index.php/kulongesa-tes/article/download/224/155

Finding it hard to make a determination on this as there appears little to go on about the institute's degree of independence. University itself needs to be added to ROR and would be in scope, for which I will create an issue.

05/18/2022, 15:56:19 | 05/18/2022, 15:56:19
comment_text: Yes definitely we should have an entry for Universidade Lueji A'Nkonde. 

From the "about" page here: https://www.ipls.ao/?page_id=835 (if I'm reading the Google translation correctly) it appears this institute was originally created and "attached" to a different university - "Universidade Agostinho Neto" - https://ror.org/0057ag334 - so I think given that it has had in some sense two parents (?) it qualifies as sufficiently independent to be listed separately. Also some of the affiliation usage does not mention the Lueji A'Nkonde connection, and the website differs. So yes I think both that university and this institute should have ROR ids.

It's not exactly too new or out of scope for ROR, but at a nebulous threshold of being established because of the lack of research outputs.

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
Czech Academy of Sciences, Institute of Czech Literature https://ror.org/01vr20t27
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Update record:
Name of organization: Czech Academy of Sciences, Institute of Czech Literature
ROR ID: https://ror.org/01vr20t27
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Other names or name versions listed in the record, Other IDs for the organization
Description of change: The affiliation of our organization was updated. We need to update this change in other systems - ROR, ORCID. (https://www.lib.cas.cz/podpora/data/asep/identifikatory/priloha-pokynu-2_2020.xlsx)
Primary name: Czech Academy of Sciences, Institute of Czech Literature
Other names: Institute of Czech Literature of the Czech Academy of Sciences
OR Ústav pro českou literaturu AV ČR, v. v. i.
Correct ISNI - the correct id is 0000 0001 2109 5895 - https://isni.org/isni/0000000121095895

0000 0004 0428 8574 - https://isni.org/isni/0000000404288574 is the second place of employment, not main
comments: adambuttrick 06/07/2022, 20:51:48 | 06/07/2022, 20:51:48 comment_text: Changes here overlap and have downstream consequences for #433, so treating them as one issue. Updating all records in #433 to correspond to the preferred name/variant forms. --- adambuttrick 06/17/2022, 00:28:16 | 06/17/2022, 00:28:16 comment_text: Record updated in release v1.1. --- jdvorak001 06/18/2022, 16:55:56 | 06/18/2022, 16:55:56 comment_text: @adambuttrick , I can see you took a different route than the one originally planned in #433, but this one is also fine. Now just https://ror.org/00angvn73 is having a small scratch, the name "Institute of Biophysics of the Czech Academy of Sciences" should probably become "Czech Academy of Sciences, Institute of Biophysics" in order to follow the same pattern. --- adambuttrick 06/18/2022, 17:22:38 | 06/18/2022, 17:22:38 comment_text: @jdvorak001 Yes, the Library of the CAS sent us a list of official English forms just before the release, so we had to defer to these. https://ror.org/00angvn73 should have been included, but it looks as if it slipped out in error. I will create a new issue to correct. We've moved to an incremental update model, so we should be able to correct in the next month or so (vs. waiting until next quarter). --- janderova 06/20/2022, 07:29:30 | 06/20/2022, 07:29:30 comment_text: Good morning, I am librarian from Library of the Czech Academy of Sciences Katerina Janderova. I have to explain what happened and how our institution works. Czech Academy of Sciences has about 53 institutes. They are independent institutions, but Library of CAS is something like methodological centre for institutional libraries. We discussed change of names with Mr. Dvorak but then Institute of Czech Literature sent you the table with official affiliations. Both variants are correct but it is possible that other institutions will want to change their names in future - we have more variants of the names. So now we can leave it like this but there is the problem about Institute of Biophysics - there are two records: https://ror.org/034g04n73 I think this is not Czech Academy of Science, but Bulgarian Academy according to GRID, including wrong web address. https://ror.org/00angvn73 this is our Institute of Biophysics of the Czech Academy of Sciences Another problem is that our Czech Academy of Sciences, Biology Centre has five institutes - they are not in the table so they were not changed. there are: https://ror.org/039nazg33 Institute of Entomology https://ror.org/0436nxt45 Institute of Hydrobiology (ASCR) https://ror.org/05rhyza23 Institute of Parasitology [https://ror.org/00jr65m43 ](https://ror.org/00jr65m43)Institute of Plant Molecular Biology https://ror.org/02tz8r820 Institute of Soil Biology You can change them to Czech Academy of Sciences, Institute of …. https://ror.org/02tc3qm58 Technology Centre - this is an old institute, does not exist anymore we can delete it or give it status non active. Also Czech Academy of Sciences, Institute of Czech literature wrote me that there was no change in ¨their ISNI - https://ror.org/01vr20t27 correct ISNI is https://isni.org/isni/0000000121095895 Sorry about the trouble with our official names and so on and thank you and Mr. Dvorak for your help. We can put these proposals to the form if you want. Best regards Katerina Janderova, Library of the Czech Academy of Sciences janderova@knav.cz arl@knav.cz --- adambuttrick 06/20/2022, 12:35:45 | 06/20/2022, 12:35:45 comment_text: @janderova Thank you for your review and these corrections. No need to submit via the form. I will create new issue(s) to capture all of this. --- adambuttrick 06/20/2022, 17:08:54 | 06/20/2022, 17:11:32 comment_text: @janderova With regards to the ISNI for the Czech Academy of Sciences, Institute of Czech Literature - the ISNI was updated in release v1.1. You can see the value present in the record here: https://api.ror.org/organizations/https://ror.org/01vr20t27 I believe we have a display bug in the search UI where it shows the first value from the "all" field in this record, as opposed to the preferred value. I will file an issue with our dev team to get this corrected. --- janderova 06/21/2022, 07:09:36 | 06/21/2022, 07:09:36 comment_text: @adambuttrick Thank you, I informed about that Mrs. Zemanova from Czech Academy of Sciences, Institute of Czech Literature. --- jdvorak001 06/21/2022, 08:00:03 | 06/21/2022, 08:00:03 comment_text: The Technology Centre, https://ror.org/02tc3qm58, https://www.tc.cz/en, is still alive and kicking. Regarding their relationship with the CAS — quoting from their own webpage, https://www.tc.cz/en/about-us : > The Technology Centre of the CAS is a non-profit association of legal entities, it is not an institute of the Czech Academy of Sciences according to Act No. 283/1992 Coll., and it is not funded by the budget of the Czech Academy of Sciences. The outputs of the Technology Centre of the CAS contain independent expert opinions and do not express the official position of the Czech Academy of Sciences or individual members of the association. While they never were one of the CAS institutes, they were formed with stakes of some those institutes (but there were other stakes, too) and were given the name with the "... of the CAS" ending, which has turned out to be misleading in the long run. --- janderova 06/21/2022, 08:35:51 | 06/21/2022, 08:35:51 comment_text: @jdvorak001@adambuttrick Thank you for you commentary - Yes, The Technology Centre is NOT an institute of the Czech Academy of Sciences. Sorry I wrote that it doesn´t exist. ---

title: Project: Additional Czech Academy of Sciences Record Updates
body:
The Czech Academy of Sciences has identified five additional records that should be updated to correspond to the rest of the set. The five records that need updating are:

- https://ror.org/039nazg33  - Institute of Entomology
- https://ror.org/0436nxt45  - Institute of Hydrobiology (ASCR)
- https://ror.org/05rhyza23 - Institute of Parasitology
- https://ror.org/00jr65m43 - Institute of Plant Molecular Biology
- https://ror.org/02tz8r820 - Institute of Soil Biology

In addition, the records should identify https://ror.org/05pq4yn02 as a parent.
comments:
adambuttrick
06/20/2022, 21:19:46 | 06/20/2022, 21:19:46
comment_text: @janderova @jdvorak001 If you have the opportunity, it would be much appreciated if you could review the updated records linked below. Hoping that you can verify that these correctly represent the Czech Academy of Sciences Biology Centre institutes:

https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates/commit/69245222910d6f8cfe568c7ef7ba4f3d1bb200b9?diff=unified

---
janderova
06/21/2022, 07:19:21 | 06/21/2022, 07:19:21
comment_text: @adambuttrick @jdvorak001 I will let you know about that I have to gain more information from the institutes.

---
jdvorak001
06/21/2022, 07:45:10 | 06/21/2022, 07:45:10
comment_text: @adambuttrick , thank you. Those five institutes had existed as independent institutes of the Czech Academy of Sciences in the past. In 2006 they were merged to form the Biology Centre and they seem to continue their existence as divisions within that centre (cf. https://www.bc.cas.cz/en/about-us/ and the organizational structure chart file). I'd therefore suggest having the Biology Centre (https://ror.org/05pq4yn02) as the parent, not the entire CAS.

---
janderova
06/21/2022, 08:01:30 | 06/21/2022, 08:01:30
comment_text: @jdvorak001 @adambuttrick Please wait with correction, we would prefer have just one institute - Biology Centre but I have to discuss it with the Institutes.

body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Update record:
Name of organization: Max Planck Institute for European Legal History
ROR ID: https://ror.org/00jpzvz45
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Other names or name versions listed in the record, Organization website, Other IDs for the organization
Description of change: As of January 2021, the institute's designation has changed to "Max Planck Institute for Legal History and Legal Theory" ("Max-Planck-Institut für Rechtsgeschichte und Rechtstheorie") subsequent to the establishment of a third research department in September 2020 (see: https://www.lhlt.mpg.de/institute; https://d-nb.info/gnd/1231401982).

The previously used designation "Max Planck Institute for European Legal History" ("Max-Planck-Institut für europäische Rechtsgeschichte") should be kept in the record as an alternative (outdated) name version for retrieval purposes.

The provided web address in the record should be changed accordingly to: https://www.lhlt.mpg.de/en

The linked ISNI (0000000121777175) and GRID (grid.461787.b) records refer to the old institute name. The already linked Wikidata record (Q1912108) contains the updated information, as well as the yet unlinked RINGOLD record (RINGGOLD-ID 28275). 

Update: change.name==Max Planck Institute for Legal History and Legal Theory; replace.labels==Max-Planck-Institut für Rechtsgeschichte und Rechtstheorie*German; replace.aliases==Max Planck Institute for European Legal History; add.aliases==Max-Planck-Institut für europäische Rechtsgeschichte; replace.links==https://www.lhlt.mpg.de; replace.wikipedia_url==https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Max-Planck-Institut_f%C3%BCr_Rechtsgeschichte_und_Rechtstheorie;$

Ringgold IDs are not indexed in ROR.

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
The George Washington University https://ror.org/00y4zzh67
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Update record:
Name of organization: The George Washington University
ROR ID: https://ror.org/00y4zzh67
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Other names or name versions listed in the record
Description of change: According the the university's identity guidelines PDF at https://creativeservices.gwu.edu/sites/g/files/zaxdzs2746/f/downloads/GW_Identity_Guidelines_v123-2019.pdf the official, preferred name is "The George Washington University" -- the ROR record currently lacks the article "The." The university also prefers the acronym "GW" to "GWU," but its website is gwu.edu. Wikidata has the name without the article as the primary name and uses The George Washington university as an alternate name, so it's a judgment call: https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q432637

Update: add.acronyms==GW;$
comments:
adambuttrick
06/22/2022, 22:00:07 | 06/22/2022, 22:05:02
comment_text: Library of Congress authority file drops the leading article in all of its [references](https://id.loc.gov/search/?q=%22George+Washington+University%22&q=cs%3Ahttp%3A%2F%2Fid.loc.gov%2Fauthorities%2Fnames). Affiliation usage likewise does not appear to make use of it (e.g. https://doi.org/10.1016/S0040-1625(97)00163-7 ; https://doi.org/10.1097/00019514-199806020-00003). We should add "GW" as an acronym, as it is their preferred abbreviation, but I would recommend keeping "GWU" for the sake of discoverability.

---
adambuttrick
08/03/2022, 21:41:50 | 08/03/2022, 21:41:50
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.3.

---

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Rennes https://ror.org/05qec5a53
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Update record:
Name of organization: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Rennes
ROR ID: https://ror.org/05qec5a53
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Other names or name versions listed in the record
Description of change: Add acronym "CHU" See https://github.com/ror-community/ror-api/issues/246

Update: add.aliases==CHU Rennes;$
comments:
adambuttrick
07/06/2022, 17:20:34 | 07/06/2022, 17:28:18
comment_text: "CHU" as an acronym would only correspond to the "Centre Hospitalier Universitaire" of the organization's name, so I don't think it makes sense to add it as an acronym. After reviewing https://github.com/ror-community/ror-api/issues/246, I think the best option is to add "CHU Rennes" as an alias, which I see in use in various places. I can't find any use of "CHUR," but we could add that as well. 

I do however think that the affiliation search shouldn't fail because of "de" in the alias and the user is right that this is an error/improvement needed in our handling. The normal query route handles this fine and returns the expected organization as the first result:

https://api.ror.org/organizations?query=CHU%20Rennes

---
amandafrench
07/06/2022, 18:06:15 | 07/06/2022, 18:06:15
comment_text: Sounds good! 

---
adambuttrick
08/03/2022, 21:42:21 | 08/03/2022, 21:42:21
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.3.

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
l'Assurance Maladie https://ror.org/03am7sg53
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Update record:
Name of organization: l'Assurance Maladie
ROR ID: https://ror.org/03am7sg53
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name, Other names or name versions listed in the record
Description of change: This organisation has many names (see https://isni.org/isni/0000000110918892), a lot of which don't correspond with the organisation when searched for (query or affiliation)

Update: add.aliases==Ameli; add.aliases==Caisse nationale de l’assurance maladie; add.aliases==Caisse nationale de l'assurance maladie des travailleurs salariés; add.acronyms==CNAM; add.acronyms=CNAMTS; add.labels==National Fund for Health Insurance*English;$
comments:
adambuttrick
07/06/2022, 16:20:33 | 07/06/2022, 16:20:33
comment_text: Current name in ROR corresponds to the name used on the organization's website and branding. Request here would be to add some subset of the ISNI names (many are minor variants with overlapping text) as aliases. This is probably fine, but not certain about the provenance of ISNI name data.

---
Goldensteev
07/07/2022, 07:45:39 | 07/07/2022, 07:45:39
comment_text: I submitted this request and i think the many names stem from the fact that this organisation is quite old and has had rebrands.
CNAMTS or (Caisse nationale de l'assurance maladie des travailleurs salariés) was the original name from what i gather when it was created. [Ameli](https://www.ameli.fr/) is the name of there website and the main brand for them for french citizens.

Also, and this is quite annoying but CNAM can either be : 
- [**le** CNAM](https://www.cnam.fr/) ; https://ror.org/0175hh227
- [**la** CNAM](https://assurance-maladie.ameli.fr/qui-sommes-nous/organisation/cnam-tete-reseau)
 
a lot of people use CNAM to designate the second one as seen in these : 
- https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35752614/
- https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/31569513/
- https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29799296/

---
adambuttrick
07/07/2022, 15:50:37 | 07/07/2022, 15:50:37
comment_text: @Goldensteev Thank you for these details. Could you identify the most common, currently in use subset of name variants and we can add these? From your comments, these appear to be "Caisse nationale de l'assurance maladie des travailleurs salariés," "Ameli," and the acronym CNAM. 

---
Goldensteev
07/07/2022, 16:15:52 | 07/07/2022, 16:15:52
comment_text: - **Ameli** is very common among regular french citizens and not researchers as much but i think it would make sense to add it nonetheless
- **CNAMTS** is an old ACRONYM but i think still used and was used in old papers as far as i gather.
- **CNAM** is necessary as most of the time this will be the main ACRONYM used by researchers 
- **French National Health Insurance** could also be another one added. 

---
adambuttrick
07/07/2022, 16:34:51 | 07/07/2022, 16:34:51
comment_text: @Goldensteev Thank you. We will get these added in our next release.

---
adambuttrick
08/03/2022, 21:42:25 | 08/03/2022, 21:42:25
comment_text: Record updated in release v1.3.

adambuttrick
06/09/2022, 22:33:42 | 06/09/2022, 22:35:24
comment_text: Anti-child exploitation advocacy and treatment organization in Columbia. I'm not seeing much in the way of affiliation usage, although there are several references to the organization from researchers outside it such that I think they are providing some kind of research support or access to others(e.g. https://repositorio.unicartagena.edu.co/handle/11227/4753; https://intellectum.unisabana.edu.co/handle/10818/4133). Their director, Luz Stella Cárdenas Ovalle, has also written [book chapters](https://argumentos.xoc.uam.mx/index.php/argumentos/article/view/34/33) in the organization's focus area. In addition to the report linked in the request, they also publish [diagnostic guidelines and statistical reports](diagnostic guidelines and statistical reports), so I think they are just past the threshold of being in scope.

adambuttrick
06/17/2022, 16:23:35 | 06/17/2022, 16:25:07
comment_text: According to the National Standardization Agency of Indonesia's org chart, this is a sub-unit of the main standardization office, which would lean toward it being out of scope (not a top-level entity):

https://bsn.go.id/main/berita/detail/11204/struktur-organisasi

But it looks like we have some precedent for sub-entity directorates in ROR (https://ror.org/search?query=directorate), for which this organization has two (Direktorat Standar Nasional Satuan Ukuran Mekanika, Radiasi, dan Biologi and the Direktorat Standar Nasional Satuan Ukuran Termoelektrik dan Kimia). Likewise, this likely fits our facility acknowledgement use case. Moving to Second Review for further consideration by the curation team. 



---
arthurpsmith
07/15/2022, 18:32:04 | 07/15/2022, 18:32:04
comment_text: Yeah I think usually we're pretty generous in allowing subsidiaries of government agencies to have their own ROR id's if they are sufficiently involved in research. In this case I can find a list a couple of hundred papers with Google Scholar that seem to have this specific affiliation, so I do think it qualifies. Let's add it to ROR.

adambuttrick
07/28/2022, 16:39:21 | 07/28/2022, 16:39:21
comment_text: Name changes correspond to organization's website and branding. Same as #918, there's no harm in adding the German name as a label, but both of these should probably be discussed as part of the overall consideration of label's scope in our 08/2022 curation team meeting.

adambuttrick
08/02/2022, 16:41:19 | 08/02/2022, 16:42:02
comment_text: Accommodating this request, per discussion at curation team meeting on 2022/08/02. While ROR will not establish as a general policy the indexing of the primary name as a label, the need here, in the context of an integration, is sensible. In the future, we will likely alter the schema to include languages for every name field, as well as potentially collapse the variant name fields (acronyms, aliases, label) into a single field with both language and type qualifiers.

comments:
adambuttrick
01/19/2022, 18:34:18 | 01/19/2022, 22:33:35
comment_text: Can find no instances of affiliation usage. Publication provided is an announcement from the org's website describing the opening of the facility, seemingly as part of North China Electric Power University. Would need something else further to establish its independence. Otherwise, appears out of scope. Would recommend rolling up to primary ROR ID for North China Electric Power University (https://ror.org/04qr5t414)

---
arthurpsmith
01/31/2022, 19:29:11 | 01/31/2022, 19:29:11
comment_text: Hmm, when I search the exact proposed name on Google Scholar I get a lot of hits:
https://scholar.google.com/scholar?start=30&q=%22Suzhou+institute+of+North+China+Electric+Power+University%22&hl=en&as_sdt=0,33
However they all appear to be publications in Chinese journals, which can be downloaded only from CNKI (and I don't have access)?
I think this is a major research institute, well-established (since at least 2012, I don't know where the 2021 date came from in the input data) and it is physically separate from the main university. On the other hand their website domain is a subdomain of the main university site, and there's no sign they have another "parent" organization besides the university. So if we were including non-top-level institutes then I think this should definitely be in ROR; as it is it probably is out of scope. But maybe needs further discussion? If we had somebody more familiar with Chinese organizations that might help here!


---
adambuttrick
01/31/2022, 20:03:24 | 01/31/2022, 20:06:35
comment_text: Fixed the date, since this was appears to have been a typo in the request. 

@arthurpsmith Good catch. I had assumed these were errant as they did not appear in the author affiliations or the page source of the CNKI pages. After subtracting out the CNKI articles that were polluting the Google Scholar results, I was able to find "Suzhou institute of North China Electric Power University" as an affiliation in IEEE (https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/6330107 ; https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/6896157 ; https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/6330107), with the only caveat being that the author's profiles use the university affiliation, not the institute (e.g., https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/author/37304066300 ; https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/author/37405735500 ; https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/author/38543674000).

Other information about this request:
comments:
adambuttrick
05/05/2022, 21:00:12 | 05/05/2022, 21:00:12
comment_text: Interdisciplinary Belgian arts organization. While a little out of the usual for ROR, published in [academic journals](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/ece3.888), book chapters and the like with this affiliation (see their [publications](https://fo.am/publications/) for further examples). Independent, top-level entity. Should be added to ROR.

---
nlundvick
05/26/2022, 19:21:28 | 05/26/2022, 19:21:28
comment_text: Related organization (https://ror.org/02weea238) is "FOAM" but includes "FOAM KERNOW" as an alias and the website is https://fo.am/kernow/. The FoAM Kernow studio is no longer an active organization name (superseded by "Then Try This"). Also, I don't think under current ROR scope policies that the Kernow child organization would be added, and that we would add the parent organization, FoAM, instead. Update existing ROR record to represent the top-level organization, FoAM? Moving to needs discussion.

---
mariagould
06/07/2022, 14:59:09 | 06/07/2022, 14:59:09
comment_text: I agree with @nlundvick. Recommend updating the existing record in ROR.

---
adambuttrick
06/22/2022, 21:01:51 | 06/22/2022, 21:01:51
comment_text: I'm seeing a lot of historic affiliation usage for FoAM Kernow:

https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pbio.3000258
https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/mec.14528
https://www.uaconferences.org/docs/UACE2017_Papers/897_UACE2017.pdf
https://royalsocietypublishing.org/doi/full/10.1098/rspb.2020.2823

Likewise, FoAM Kernow was located in a different country from FoAM (UK vs. Belgium) and was replaced by another organization ("Then Try This"), with both "Then Try This" and the broader FoAM organization still being active. If we updated FoAM Kernow to represent FoAM, users would have no way to retroactively index these records, nor could we represent the "Then Try This" supercession.

My recommendation would be that we deprecate FoAM Kernow record and create a new record for the FoAM parent body and create a relationship between the two.

---
adambuttrick
06/22/2022, 21:32:04 | 06/22/2022, 21:32:04
comment_text: Per discussion with @mariagould  on 2022/06/22, https://ror.org/02weea238 represents Foam Kernow and should be updated to represent new details for the organization, "Then Try This." Approving this request and creating separate update request for https://ror.org/02weea23.

---
adambuttrick
08/03/2022, 21:41:18 | 08/03/2022, 21:41:18
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/00m5fe987 in release v1.3.

Name of organization: International Union for Conservation of Nature, French Committee
Website: https://uicn.fr
Link to publications: 
Organization type: Nonprofit
Wikipedia page: https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comit%C3%A9_fran%C3%A7ais_de_l'UICN
Wikidata ID: Q74001573
ISNI ID: 
GRID ID: 
Crossref Funder ID: 
Aliases: UICN Comité Français; IUCN French Committee
Labels: Union Internationale Pour la Conservation de la Nature, Comité Français*French
Acronym/abbreviation: IUCN FC; UICN CF
Related organizations: https://ror.org/04tehfn33 (parent)
City: Paris
Country: France
Geonames ID: 2988507
Year established: 1901
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? 

Other information about this request: 
Merge/split/deprecate records:
Organizations affected by this change: International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN)
ROR ID(s) of organization(s) affected by this change: 04tehfn33
How should the record(s) be changed?  Dear ROR team,

I suggest that an entry in the ROR database be created for the French committee of IUCN (Comité Français de l'UICN) as a subset of that of IUCN (04tehfn33). This could be an entry similar to that of the Guinea-Bissau and other national committees that already have an entry.
I would like to specify that I am only a member of the committee and that I am not acting here officially on behalf of the French committee. It is just a personal suggestion.

Best regards,

Luis

The French Committee of IUCN web site is : https://uicn.fr/
The Comité Français de l'UICN page in wikipedia (France) is : https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comit%C3%A9_fran%C3%A7ais_de_l'UICN
The French Committee of IUCN page in wikidata is : https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q74001573
comments:
adambuttrick
06/27/2022, 22:28:27 | 06/27/2022, 22:28:27
comment_text: Requestor is correct that we have inherited national sub-entities of the International Union for Conservation of Nature (e.g. https://ror.org/01szdrn56 ; https://ror.org/00yq23r19), so this is likely in scope by that precedent. There is likewise affiliation usage that references this form as well (https://hal.inrae.fr/hal-02790488) and the committee appears to be a long-standing organization (founded in 1901).

Separately, all of these records should be cleaned up, with their names updated to reflect them as national manifestations of the parent body, with the creation of corresponding relationships. I will create a separate issue for this.

---
KellyStathis
06/30/2022, 07:11:02 | 06/30/2022, 07:11:02
comment_text: I agree this is in scope for ROR and that a new child record is required. For the clean-up, I also agree the country should be in the primary name. 

---
adambuttrick
08/03/2022, 21:39:57 | 08/03/2022, 21:39:57
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/03tv49k22 in release v1.3.

arthurpsmith
10/12/2021, 14:18:59 | 10/12/2021, 14:18:59
comment_text: The article referenced in the "Link to Publications" is here:  doi:10.1001/jamaneurol.2021.0428 - this is a "Viewpoint" article, not a regular research article. Also it doesn't refer to LMSA as an affiliation but (as far as I can see) only in this sentence: "... long-established organizations (eg, American Academy of Neurology, Student National Medical Association, Latino Medical Student Association) have sponsored virtual specialty panels to increase information access for their members."

The request mentions articles surveying LMSA members, but that still doesn't seem to really fall into the scope of ROR. While this seems to be a worthwhile organization in what it does, I don't think it needs or qualifies for a ROR id.

comment_text: Joint pharmacoepidemiological research institute by the [University of Bordeaux](https://ror.org/057qpr032), its [research hospital](https://ror.org/01hq89f96 ), and its sub-entity the [Bergonié Institute](https://ror.org/02yw1f353). Not a top-level entity, but a kind of joint project between several in-scope orgs. Used as a [primary affiliation](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/26017643/) on works where the University of Bordeaux is also used as affiliation, as well as as a [leading affiliation](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/26301735/) for the university. From the affiliation usage, it looks as if there is a distinction that needs to be made for tracking research outputs, so I would say this is likely in scope, but would like to hear other's thoughts.

Publication affiliation usage: https://researchinvolvement.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s40900-021-00271-4 ; https://doi.org/10.21203/rs.3.rs-934285/v1

ORCID affiliation usage: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-0316-3254

---
mariagould
07/26/2022, 23:27:14 | 07/26/2022, 23:27:14
comment_text: Concur this should be added to ROR given evidence of research activities. 

---
adambuttrick
08/03/2022, 21:40:10 | 08/03/2022, 21:40:10
comment_text: Assigned ROR ID https://ror.org/0282y0p95 in release v1.3.

title: Project: Relationships with type "Other"
body:
GRID created nine records with the relationship type, "Other," which we inherited during our sync with the service. This type is not schema-valid for ROR, so these relationships should be updated to the type, "Related."
[20220811_bad_relationships.csv](https://github.com/ror-community/ror-updates/files/9312445/20220811_bad_relationships.csv)
